data.description: Job Description SummaryJob DescriptionGE Vernova's Greenville facility is not only GE's largest gas turbine manufacturing site, but also home to the development and industrialization of technologies for turbine service and repair. The AMRT Process Development Engineer will be instrumental in creating, industrializing, and supporting robotics and automation processes and systems. The Intern will play a crucial role in developing cutting-edge Automation, Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Machine Learning (ML) applications. These applications are designed to support efficient engineering development through real-time feedback mechanisms.The deliverables will encompass versatile solutions that can be applied, expanded, and scaled across a variety of engineering solutions. Wherever feasible, these solutions will include comprehensive testing, implementation, and thorough documentation.Key Skills and CompetenciesProgramming: adheres to software development best practices.Robotics: Knowledgeable in robotic systems, sensors, and control algorithms.Automation: capable of implementing automated processes.Process Development: Skilled in developing and optimizing workflows using Lean methodologies.Testing and Validation: Proficient in creating and executing comprehensive test plansDocumentation: Strong skills in producing clear and detailed technical documentationProblem Solving: Excellent analytical skills and ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.Collaboration: Effective teamwork and communication skillsProject Management: capable of managing project timelines, resources, and deliverables.Additional CompetenciesUnderstanding of GE Vernova's Products: Knowledge of GE Vernova’s product offerings, capabilities, and limitations.Business Acumen: Understands business objectives and strategic goalsBasic Qualifications:-Pursuing a Masters degree in Engineering.-Minimum GPA of 4.0/5.0.Desired Qualifications:• Knowledge of robot operations, sensors, servo systems and motion control systems• Knowledge of Machine Learning and AI Tools• Knowledge of process technology such as: Machining, Robotics, Automation, Joining, Coating, and Inspection technologies• Experience with experimentation and root cause analysis• Good project management skills. Ability to work on multiple projects• Ability to learn, share and train all levels of personnel in newly developed processes• Demonstrated problem solving skills• Strong interpersonal and leadership skills• Familiarity with hands-on creation, manufacturing, engineering lab, and quality systems• Product knowledge of gas turbines / turbo machinery is a plusBenefits Available to you: Addressing the climate crisis is an urgent global priority, and at GE Vernova, we take our responsibility seriously. That is the singular mission of GE Vernova: to continue electrifying the world while simultaneously working to help decarbonize it. In order to meet this mission, we provide varied, competitive benefits to help support our workforce: Our Culture | GE Vernova (gecareers.com)The pay for this position ranges from $35/hr. based on years of graduate field of study completed.This position is also eligible for:Relocation Assistance: Co-op/Interns will be reimbursed for reasonable, proper, and documented expenditures incurred while initially reporting to work and returning to school/home upon completion of the assignment. Employees with a permanent address greater than 50 miles away from the work location are eligible.Housing Allowance: Co-op/Interns employees receive a weekly housing allowance to help off-set living expenses when the co-op/Intern’s permanent residence is at least 50 miles away from the work location.Employee Assistance Program, providing 24/7 confidential assessment, counseling and referral servicesGE Retirement Savings Plan (RSP) after their accumulated service reaches 90 days, and they meet any other eligibility requirements as defined in the plans. (Eligibility occurs on the 1st of the month following the 90th day.)General Electric Company, Ropcor, Inc., their successors, and in some cases their affiliates, each sponsor certain employee benefit plans or programs (i.e., is a Sponsor”). Each Sponsor reserves the right to terminate, amend, suspend, replace, or modify its benefit plans and programs at any time and for any reason, in its sole discretion. No individual has a vested right to any benefit under a Sponsor’s welfare benefit plan or program. This document does not create a contract of employment with any individual.Inclusion At GE Vernova, we believe in the value of your unique identity, background and experiences. We are committed to fostering an inclusive culture, where everyone feels empowered to do their best work because they feel accepted, respected and that they belong. Click here to learn more: https://jobs.gecareers.com/vernova/global/en/i-d-eThis position will remain open until at least November 1, 2025.Additional InformationGE Vernova offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE Vernova is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.GE Vernova will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). Relocation Assistance Provided: No
requirements: GE Retirement Savings Plan (RSP) after their accumulated service reaches 90 days, and they meet any other eligibility requirements as defined in the plans. (Eligibility occurs on the 1st of the month following the 90th day.)
responsibilities: Relocation Assistance: Co-op/Interns will be reimbursed for reasonable, proper, and documented expenditures incurred while initially reporting to work and returning to school/home upon completion of the assignment. Employees with a permanent address greater than 50 miles away from the work location are eligible.
